result.name: binomial

result.post: was attributable to the larger shoot height and higher density of the plant, and these characteris
result.name: binomial

result.post: plants to be more competitive. The populations in our study may have evolved to be more competitiv
result.name: binomial

result.post: populations in Europe tended to grow smaller than their counterparts from the native populations i

result.pre: In summary, the
result.post: invasion increases nutrient accumulation in the plants and nutrient availability in the soil. Thes
result.name: binomial

result.pre: se of soil nutrient concentrations and microbial activity probably promote the further invasion of
result.post: through a positive feedback loop and is likely one important mechanism of its success in the invad
result.name: binomial

result.pre: anism of its success in the invaded region. The driving forces of accelerating nutrient cycling by
result.post: need to be further examined in controlled studies.
